list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Corrected the offset of location and text in makeSRStructFirst() (sentence.py) to cater for keywords that contain symbols on either side of the text, such as 'Action/Graph Editors,', noticed the comma punctuation at the end.

task.summary: Default task
Added commitCacheEntry, allowing a single dict entry to be added, for convenient

Added binarySearch with key as a function, with a provision of default array index extraction. This will allows reusabilities in the future. Plus, LocationObserver has the ability to check if a location in the string is usable or not, ie. not overlapped with an used one. Genmap has the ability to filter out all references, marking them as used, before allocating a breakdown of sentences, so it will not break a reference in the middle of it, but will take it as a whole.
Reuse of LocationObserver in Common.isPath to simpify the code.
Adding exception handling part to print the routine name automatically; Adding code to collect and print out the list of structure record parsed, and some minor changes

Added checking for ending with punctuations and added the pattern checks for no ending punctuations to the getSentStructPattern(), allowing the NO_FULL_STOP and NO_PUNCTUATION cases to check for no ending punctuations as well.

Introduced the concept of multiple flags, and thus simplified check cases for each sentence structure mode. Each flag of checking mode is separated with a forward slash '/' and all results are stacked in a list. At the end, all flags are checked, if one is False then the whole expression is considered False and the fragment of text won't be selected for that pattern.
First stage getting the ordered variables $$1 $$2 etc.. working

Reimplementing the notations for sentence structure controlling variables, using ${order_number/mode1/mode2...} instead of the simple $$$/mode, or $$1 before. This will allow greater, and more accurate controls of how each conditions affects the result of text fragment selection.
Corrected the wrong index usage ibn the getInitialListOfTextsToBeTranslated, dict_sl_smode_list must use 'from_index' instead.

Simplify the code for loading dictionary. Ensure that a lower key set is embedded within the NoCaseDict, allowing the fuzzy translation to search for a smaller set accurately, plus inserted the NO-CASE flag for recog_pattern, allowing the splitting of input text accucrately, using recog_pattern.

Thinking about the possibility of a new param in sent-structure, position priority, giving the control about the fuzzy weight with regards to the position of param in the sentence. Not yet clear the direction of implementation, so temporary pausing. Enable local_keys sorted after loading the Dictionary.

Removed the code reporting exception in setupRecords() for obvious reason when handling text components only instead. Turn on the debugging code for the pattern selective table to allow watching what has been selected and what is on top of the table, ie, what is selected.

First stage enabling the searching for combined words using a separator, such as a forward slash (ie. hiding/unhiding), first separate them out, second removing ending 'ing' to put back 'e', becoming hide/unhide and find them individually before combining the translations back. Moving lots of code from translation_finder.py over to nocasedict.py but will probably removed later. Too SLOW. Noted though a small change in the simpleFuzzyTranslate() - removed binary search part and compiling key_list on fly using [x for x in dict.keys() if x.startswith(k_part) and len(x.split()) <= k_word_count * 1.5]. This code COULD prove to be slower. WILL need for testing and verify.

Improved the caching of key_list, so next search won't need to find it again, improving the search time. Corrected the problem in blindTranslte() which text placement messed up due to obs is not being used, leading to previous text being overwritten.

Turned out my original binarySearch method and array back/forthward for gathering items from the local_keys IS FAR quicker (thousand times) then the filtering method - using time.perf_counter() to work out the time-before and time-after (then subtract). Corrected also the sharing variable names within the getTranBySlittingSymbols(), in SimpleBlindTranslation()
Introduced tranByPartitioning into nocasedict.py. This is a generic routine that can be used throughout the code.
Added NUMBER_ONLY (nbr) to recognise the number only words.

Added PATTERN recognition, allowing patterns to be embedded within the ANY setence structure variables, ie. ${`(pattern_txt)`}. This allows patterns, such as 'be edited' => '${`(be|been|were|was|is|are)`} edited', extends the possibilities of using this preset in many circumstances
Corrected an error in the def getSentStructPattern(self, key) (nocasedict.py)

Corrected the offset of location and text in makeSRStructFirst() (sentence.py) to cater for keywords that contain symbols on either side of the text, such as 'Action/Graph Editors,', noticed the comma punctuation at the end.

MESSAGE.value: Added commitCacheEntry, allowing a single dict entry to be added, for convenient

Added binarySearch with key as a function, with a provision of default array index extraction. This will allows reusabilities in the future. Plus, LocationObserver has the ability to check if a location in the string is usable or not, ie. not overlapped with an used one. Genmap has the ability to filter out all references, marking them as used, before allocating a breakdown of sentences, so it will not break a reference in the middle of it, but will take it as a whole.
Reuse of LocationObserver in Common.isPath to simpify the code.
Adding exception handling part to print the routine name automatically; Adding code to collect and print out the list of structure record parsed, and some minor changes

Added checking for ending with punctuations and added the pattern checks for no ending punctuations to the getSentStructPattern(), allowing the NO_FULL_STOP and NO_PUNCTUATION cases to check for no ending punctuations as well.

Introduced the concept of multiple flags, and thus simplified check cases for each sentence structure mode. Each flag of checking mode is separated with a forward slash '/' and all results are stacked in a list. At the end, all flags are checked, if one is False then the whole expression is considered False and the fragment of text won't be selected for that pattern.
First stage getting the ordered variables $$1 $$2 etc.. working

Reimplementing the notations for sentence structure controlling variables, using ${order_number/mode1/mode2...} instead of the simple $$$/mode, or $$1 before. This will allow greater, and more accurate controls of how each conditions affects the result of text fragment selection.
Corrected the wrong index usage ibn the getInitialListOfTextsToBeTranslated, dict_sl_smode_list must use 'from_index' instead.
Added the case-insensitivity to the getSentStructPattern in nocasedict.py, so the comparisons will not stop because of the case differences between dictionary entries and the input text fragments.

Simplify the code for loading dictionary. Ensure that a lower key set is embedded within the NoCaseDict, allowing the fuzzy translation to search for a smaller set accurately, plus inserted the NO-CASE flag for recog_pattern, allowing the splitting of input text accucrately, using recog_pattern.

Thinking about the possibility of a new param in sent-structure, position priority, giving the control about the fuzzy weight with regards to the position of param in the sentence. Not yet clear the direction of implementation, so temporary pausing. Enable local_keys sorted after loading the Dictionary.

Removed the code reporting exception in setupRecords() for obvious reason when handling text components only instead. Turn on the debugging code for the pattern selective table to allow watching what has been selected and what is on top of the table, ie, what is selected.

First stage enabling the searching for combined words using a separator, such as a forward slash (ie. hiding/unhiding), first separate them out, second removing ending 'ing' to put back 'e', becoming hide/unhide and find them individually before combining the translations back. Moving lots of code from translation_finder.py over to nocasedict.py but will probably removed later. Too SLOW. Noted though a small change in the simpleFuzzyTranslate() - removed binary search part and compiling key_list on fly using [x for x in dict.keys() if x.startswith(k_part) and len(x.split()) <= k_word_count * 1.5]. This code COULD prove to be slower. WILL need for testing and verify.

Improved the caching of key_list, so next search won't need to find it again, improving the search time. Corrected the problem in blindTranslte() which text placement messed up due to obs is not being used, leading to previous text being overwritten.

Turned out my original binarySearch method and array back/forthward for gathering items from the local_keys IS FAR quicker (thousand times) then the filtering method - using time.perf_counter() to work out the time-before and time-after (then subtract). Corrected also the sharing variable names within the getTranBySlittingSymbols(), in SimpleBlindTranslation()
Introduced tranByPartitioning into nocasedict.py. This is a generic routine that can be used throughout the code.
Added NUMBER_ONLY (nbr) to recognise the number only words.

Added PATTERN recognition, allowing patterns to be embedded within the ANY setence structure variables, ie. ${`(pattern_txt)`}. This allows patterns, such as 'be edited' => '${`(be|been|were|was|is|are)`} edited', extends the possibilities of using this preset in many circumstances
Corrected an error in the def getSentStructPattern(self, key) (nocasedict.py)

Corrected the offset of location and text in makeSRStructFirst() (sentence.py) to cater for keywords that contain symbols on either side of the text, such as 'Action/Graph Editors,', noticed the comma punctuation at the end.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
